markdown:
<title level="1" pfs="">[Giant Aukashungi](/Monsters.aspx?ID=526)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

The strongest individual in an aukashungi swarm eventually grows to monstrous proportions.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Aberration](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11)): DC 34

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 32

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 29
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/GiantAukashungi.png" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 14">[Giant Aukashungi](/Monsters.aspx?ID=526)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="CE" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Huge" />
<trait label="Aberration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=1" />
<trait label="Amphibious" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=207" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #154: Siege of the Dinosaurs](/Sources.aspx?ID=31) pg. 77</row>

**Perception** +24; greater darkvision

**Languages**

**Skills**
[Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +29

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +7

**Dex** +7

**Con** +6

**Int** -4

**Wis** +3

**Cha** -2
</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 36 

**Fort** +28 

**Ref** +25 

**Will** +21 

</row>

**HP** 300

**Resistances**
bludgeoning 10, piercing 15, slashing 15

**Flippable** When flipped on its back, a giant aukashungi can’t move and its soft underbelly becomes exposed. Whenever a creature critically succeeds at a melee attack roll to Strike a giant aukashungi, the attacking creature can forgo the bonus damage to flip over the giant aukashungi (all other critical hit effects apply normally, such as critical specialization effects). While flipped over, the giant aukashungi can’t use reactions, can’t Stride or Strike, takes a –2 circumstance penalty to AC and saving throws, loses its resistances, and gains weakness 10 to physical damage. The aukashungi can right itself by using the Roll Up activity and then using an action to unroll.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet, burrow 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
jaws +29 ([reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 3d12+13 piercing plus Improved Grab

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
horn +27 ([deadly 2d8](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 3d8+13 piercing

**Acidic Effluence** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([Acid](/Traits.aspx?ID=3)) The giant aukashungi releases an acidic gas from its ventral glands in a 30-foot burst. Each creature that starts its turn in the area takes 10d8 acid damage plus 2d8 [persistent acid damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) (DC 32 basic Fortitude save). The gas moves 10 feet away from the giant aukashungi each round and lasts for 1 minute. The giant aukashungi can’t use Acidic Effluence again for 1 minute.

**Roll Up** <actions string="Two Actions" />  The aukashungi protects its soft underbelly by rolling into a tight ball. The aukashungi gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC while Rolled Up, but it cannot Stride or Strike, and it rolls downhill if on a slope. If the aukashungi is grappling a creature when it Rolls Up, that creature must succeed at a DC 35 Fortitude save or become Swallowed Whole. The aukashungi can unroll with a single action (this action has the  <%TRAITS%114%%> move <%END trait).

**[Swallow Whole](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=35)** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Attack](/Traits.aspx?ID=15)) Large, 15d6+6 bludgeoning, Rupture 27

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_5_TreasureAndRewards.png">Carcass Full of Treasure</title>

Aukashungis can’t digest non-organic materials, which gradually accumulate in the first of their three stomachs. Giant aukashungis that have had long, successful lives hunting prey often bulge with the spoils of their victims, and those swallowed by the creatures can sometimes cut themselves free with a weapon discovered in the monster’s gut.
</aside>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-122" />
name: Giant Aukashungi

</traits>

<additional-info>
<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #154: Siege of the Dinosaurs](/Sources.aspx?ID=31) pg. 77</row>

**Creature Family** [Aukashungi](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=122)

<row gap="medium">

**Perception** +24
</row>

The strongest individual in an aukashungi swarm eventually grows to monstrous proportions.
</summary>
